about_the_game:
Welcome to Designation: Hell

You're trapped here until you can recover the data from five separate terminals. Get the data and find all the hidden secrets while staying alive.

Features


  • Gritty, PSX era inspired graphics
  • Short playthrough time of about 20-30 minutes if you just want to get the data and rush out
  • However, for those players who like a good mystery there is tons to discover and piece together in the town
  • You weren't given weapons and there are things hunting you...
  • Fun, weird story to be pieced together, all written and designed by a solo developer
  • English subtitles included along with a fan translation system
  • Plenty of secrets to discover - including multiple endings!

Gameplay

In this first-person horror adventure, you control Worm. You've been dropped into Designation: Hell, and you need to explore the town in order to find several data terminals.

Throughout the town, there are many rooms to explore and secrets to uncover - but be careful, things will start hunting you at some point and the government agents haven't given you anything to defend yourself with.

The Story


You are Worm.

Or, that’s what the government agents in charge of your incarceration call you.

You’ve been sentenced to several life sentences for a series of horrible crimes. As part of your sentence, the Agency gets to use you to carry out missions no one else will do.

Supposedly, it shaves time off your sentence. You don’t care either way - at least it gets you out of your cell.

This mission is going to make you wish you had stayed in that cell.

You’ve been dropped into Designation: Hell - a strange town in the middle of nowhere where some seriously weird stuff is going down. Buildings are merging together, there are bodies everywhere, and you can sense… something following you.

They won’t let you out of Hell until you’ve gathered five very important files for them.

Move quickly, Worm. You don’t know what’s out there.

content_descriptors.notes:
This game was intended to fit in the horror genre and might not be for everyone.

The graphics are not super realistic, but there are covered-up dead bodies, random blood, and things of that nature.

No hard feelings if that isn't your jam, I totally understand!

Minimum:
  • OS *: Windows 7 (SP1+)

  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: DX11, and DX12-capable GPUs
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 1 GB available space
